required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Bridge Occlusion Balloon in Lead Extraction Procedure
clinical_study.official_title: Bridge Occlusion Balloon Initial Use in Humans Study

brief_summary.textblock: To evaluate the use of an occlusion balloon (Bridge™ Occlusion Balloon, Spectranetics) within the Superior Vena Cava in lead extraction patients.

detailed_description.textblock:
This study will evaluate the use of an occlusion balloon (Bridge™ Occlusion Balloon, Spectranetics) within the Superior Vena Cava in lead extraction patients. This will be performed in a non-emergent setting to allow for evaluation of how best to integrate this new technology into the investigators clinical practice. The study will focus on the effect of the Bridge balloon on the patient preparation clinical workflow, ease of insertion/positioning/deployment, and the ability to recognize proper inflation and vein sealing under fluoroscopy. Understanding these factors will help build a more robust clinical workflow with the goal of better patient outcomes in the case of an Superior Vena Cava injury. The images and data generated during this study can help in dissemination of the practical use knowledge to fellow lead extractors.
At the time of the protocol registration, the timeframe 12 months was entered, this was actually the anticipated length of the study at registration. The timeframe was corrected to 33 minutes (average time) at the time of results entry.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Successful Balloon Occlusion of Superior Vena Cava
primary_outcome.description: After Bridge Balloon deployment and inflation, the degree of blood vessel occlusion will be reported. Measurements will be calculated from fluoroscopic images (using x-ray machine) and venograms (images with injection of contrast agent). Successful balloon occlusion of the superior vena cava (SVC) is defined as >90% occlusion of the SVC by visual estimate using conventional venography.

secondary_outcome.description: Time will be calculated in seconds starting from opening the Bridge Balloon Package up to full balloon deployment.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Changes in Heart Rate at One Year
secondary_outcome.description: Heart Rate (in beat per minute) will be collected at 5 points: baseline, after guidewire insertion, at the time of balloon inflation, immediately post deflation and 5 minutes post deflation (all during the procedure itself). This outcome will be reported at the end of the study as if there were any unacceptable or no unacceptable changes in the hemodynamics over the course of the 12 month period.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Changes in Blood Pressure at One Year
secondary_outcome.description: Blood pressure in mmHg will be collected at 5 points: baseline, after guidewire insertion, at the time of balloon inflation, immediately post deflation and 5 minutes post deflation (all during the procedure itself). This outcome will be reported at the end of the study as as if there were any unacceptable or no unacceptable changes in the hemodynamics over the course of the 12 month period..

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Changes in SPO2 at One Year
secondary_outcome.description: SPO2 will be collected at 5 points: baseline, after guidewire insertion, at the time of balloon inflation, immediately post deflation and 5 minutes post deflation (all during the procedure itself). This outcome will be reported at the end of the study as if there were any unacceptable or no unacceptable changes in the hemodynamics over the course of the 12 month period..

arm_group.description: Bridge Balloon catheter is designed to be used for temporary vessel occlusion of the superior vena cava in applications including perioperative occlusion and emergency control of hemorrhage associated with vascular tears that may occur during lead extraction procedures.

intervention.description: The Bridge Balloon will be used in a non-emergent setting to allow for evaluation of how best to integrate this new technology into the investigators clinical practice. The study will focus on the effect of the Bridge balloon on the patient preparation clinical workflow, ease of insertion/positioning/deployment, and the ability to recognize proper inflation and vein sealing under fluoroscopy.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Subject age more than 18 years
- Lead extraction patients
Exclusion Criteria:
Lead extraction patients with:
- Superior Vena Cava occlusion or stenosis.
- Significant vegetation.
- Hemodynamic instability.
- Class IV heart failure
- Creatinine > 2.0mg/dL
- Patients > 85 years old

facility.name: Sanger Heart & Vascular Institute Carolinas HealthCare System

category.title: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander

measure.title: New York Heart Association Class
measure.description: NYHA Classification - The Stages of Heart Failure: Class I - No symptoms; Class II - Mild symptoms; Class III - Marked limitation in activity due to symptoms; Class IV - Severe limitations.

measure.title: Ejection Fraction
measure.description: Ejection fraction (EF) is a measurement, expressed as a percentage, of how much blood the left ventricle pumps out with each contraction.

event.description: An SVC tear occurred intraoperatively during the course of the study. The procedure was thoroughly reviewed by the data safety monitoring committee and it was concluded deployment of the balloon had no relation to the adverse outcome of the SVC tear.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: All Principal Investigators ARE employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.

point_of_contact.name_or_title: Jude Clancy, MD Associate Professor Term; Director, Lead Management Program
